alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 11 at 9:43PM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 942 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, further complicated by the high tide along the coast around 1130 PM to 1230 AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Hilton Head Island, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Beaufort, Port Royal, Moncks Corner, Walterboro, McClellanville, Edisto Beach, West Ashley, Ladson, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Johns Island, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Downtown Charleston, Givhans Ferry State Park and Daniel Island.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Heavy rain in Downtown Charleston will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
